    • Method Detail

      • copyTo

        public File copyTo(File targetDir)
        Copies the source file of the object to a target file. The method doesn't throw an exception. Instead it returns the null value.

        The target file must be a directory. If not then the method returns null.

        If the target file doesn't exist then it will be created.

        If the source file is a directory then it's content will be copied (all entries are copied).
        Parameters:
        targetDir - a target directory to copy to
        Returns:
        a copied file

      • copyToZip

        public boolean copyToZip(File zipFile)

        public void unzip(File zipFile,
                  String zipEntry,
                  File targetFolder)

      • copyTo

        public File copyTo(File targetDir,
                   String... newName)
        Copies the source file of the object to a target file. The method doesn't throw an exception. Instead it returns the null value. The target file must be a directory. If not then the method returns null.

        If the target file doesn't exist then it will be created.

        If the source file is a directory then it's content will be copied (all entries are copied).

        If the source file is a directory then the content of the directory will be copied (all entries are copied) to a subdirectory named newName of the target directory.

        If the source file is not a directory it will be copied to the target directory with a new name that is specified by the parameter newName. If the new name is the same as the old name then the file will be replaced.

        Parameters:
        targetDir - a target directory to copy to
        newName - a new file name
        Returns:
        a copied file

      • delete

        public static boolean delete(File file)

      • delete

        public boolean delete()
        Deletes the source file. If the source file is a directory then all the entries of the source file and the directory itself will be deleted. The method doesn't throw an exception. Instead it returns the boolean false value.
        Returns:
        the deleted file or null

      • delete

        public boolean delete(String subPath)
        Deletes the file or directory specified by path relative to the source file. If the source file is not a directory then the method returns (#code null}.

        The parameter subPath specifies the position of the file to be deleted relative to the source file.

        If the file to be deleted doesn't exists then the method returns null.

        The method doesn't throw an exception. Instead it returns the boolean false value.

        If subPatn == "/" then the method behaves as the delete().

        Parameters:
        subPath - the path of the file to be deleted relative to the source file. if subPatn == "/" then the method works as the delete().
        Returns:
        the deleted file or null

      • clear

        public boolean clear()
        Clears the content of the source file. The method doesn't throw an exception. Instead it returns the null value. If the source file is a directory then all the entries of the source file will be deleted.

        If the source file is not a directory then the method does nothing and returns null.

        Returns:
        the deleted file or null
